alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 11:59AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Randolph, central Upshur and southeastern Barbour Counties through 1230 PM EDT... At 1159 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Mill Creek, or 16 miles south of Buckhannon, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor water issues could be possible. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Buckhannon, Belington, Mill Creek, Dailey, Beverly, Junior, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Huttonsville, Alexander, Glady, Helvetia, Alton, Kerens, Ellamore, Tallmansville, Overhill and French Creek. This includes Route 33 between mile markers 16 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Upshur
